title: Frozen Planet

awardsHtml:
12 wins & 9 nominations

Primetime Emmy Awards

2012 Winner Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Nonfiction Series
Alastair Fothergill (executive producer) - Susan Winslow (executive producer) - Vanessa Berlowitz (series producer)
2012 Winner Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Cinematography for Nonfiction Programming
(Cinematography Team. For episode "Ends Of The Earth")
2012 Winner Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Sound Editing for Nonfiction Programming (Single or Multi-Camera)
Kate Hopkins (dubbing editor) - Tim Owens (sound editor) - Paul Fisher (sound editor) (For episode "Ends of The Earth")
2012 Nominee Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Sound Mixing for Nonfiction Programming
Graham Wild (dubbing mixer) - Archie Moore (sound mixer) (For episode "Ends of the Earth")
2012 Winner Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Picture Editing for Nonfiction Programming
Andy Netley (Editor) - Sharon Gillooly (Editor) (For episode "Ends of the Earth")

BAFTA Awards

2012 Nominee BAFTA TV Award
Best Director: Factual
Vanessa Berlowitz - Chadden Hunter - Kathryn Jeffs (For episode "To the Ends of the Earth")
2012 Winner BAFTA TV Award
Best Editing: Factual
2012 Nominee BAFTA TV Award
Best Original Television Music
George Fenton
2012 Winner BAFTA TV Award
Best Photography: Factual
(For episode "To the Ends of the Earth")
2012 Winner BAFTA TV Award
Best Sound: Factual
Tim Owens - Graham Wild - Kate Hopkins (For episode "To the Ends of the Earth")

Cinema Audio Society, USA

2013 Nominee C.A.S. Award
Outstanding Achievement in Sound Mixing for Television - Non-Fiction, Variety or Music - Series or Specials
Archie Moore (production mixer) - Graham Wild (re-recording mixer) (Episode: "To the Ends of the Earth (2011)")

American Cinema Editors, USA

2013 Winner Eddie
Best Edited Non-Scripted Series
Andy Netley - Sharon Gillooly (Episode: "To the Ends of the Earth (2011)")

National Television Awards, UK

2013 Winner National Television Award
Most Popular Documentary Series

Jackson Hole Film Festival

2013 Winner Best of Festival
Best Cinematography
Doug Anderson

Broadcasting Press Guild Awards

2012 Winner Broadcasting Press Guild Award
Best Documentary Series

TV Quick Awards, UK

2012 Nominee TV Quick Award
Best Factual Entertainment

International Film Music Critics Award (IFMCA)

2012 Nominee IFMCA Award
Best Original Score for a Documentary Film
George Fenton

Shanghai International TV Festival

2012 Nominee Magnolia Award
Best Documentary, Features
David Attenborough - Vanessa Berlowitz - Mark Linfield - Paul Spillenger

Bafta TV Craft

2012 Winner BAFTA Television Craft Award
Photography - Factual
Doug Anderson - Mark Smith - John Aitchison
